dublinCore.title: 113 S388 PCS: American Family Economic Protection Act of 2013
dublinCore.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid (for Ms. Mikulski (for herself, Mrs. Murray, and Mr. Reid)) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and placed on the calendar pursuant to the order of February 14, 2013

form.official-title: To appropriately limit sequestration, to eliminate tax loopholes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Family Economic Protection Act of 2013 .
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 101. Adjustments to discretionary spending limits.
Sec. 202. Supplemental agricultural disaster assistance programs.
Sec. 204. Exemption of agriculture, nutrition, and forestry from BCA sequestration.
Sec. 302. Fair share tax on high-income taxpayers.
Sec. 303. Denial of deduction for outsourcing expenses.
Sec. 304. Modifications to the tax on petroleum.

subsection.text: Section 251(c) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 ( 2 U.S.C. 901(c) ) is amended by striking paragraphs (2) through (10) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: For fiscal year 2013—

subparagraph.text: for the security category, $684,000,000,000 in new budget authority; and
for the nonsecurity category, $359,000,000,000 in new budget authority;

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2014—

subparagraph.text: for the revised security category, $552,000,000,000 in new budget authority; and
for the revised nonsecurity category, $506,000,000,000 in new budget authority;

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2015—

subparagraph.text: for the revised security category, $563,040,000,000 in new budget authority; and
for the revised nonsecurity category, $520,000,000,000 in new budget authority;

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2016—

for the revised nonsecurity category, $530,000,000,000 in new budget authority;

for the revised nonsecurity category, $553,000,000,000 in new budget authority;

for the revised nonsecurity category, $566,000,000,000 in new budget authority;

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2020—

paragraph.text: for fiscal year 2021—

subparagraph.text: for the revised security category, $638,972,000,000 in new budget authority; and

subsection.header: Postponement of Budget Control Act sequester for calendar year 2013

paragraph.text: Section 901(e) of the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012 ( Public Law 112–240 ) is repealed.
Section 251A of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act (2 U.S.C. 901a) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), as redesignated by section 101 of this Act, by striking On March 1, 2013, for fiscal year 2013, and in its sequestration preview report for fiscal years 2014 and inserting On January 2, 2014, for fiscal year 2014, and in its sequestration preview report for fiscal years 2015;

in paragraph (5), as redesignated by section 101 of this Act—

in subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text:
by striking
Fiscal years 2014–2021 and inserting Fiscal years 2015–2021 ; and
by striking 2014 each place it appears and inserting 2015.

subsection.text: The budgetary effects of this Act shall not be entered on either PAYGO scorecard maintained pursuant to section 4(d) of the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010 ( 2 U.S.C. 933(d) ).
The budgetary effects of this Act shall not be entered on any PAYGO scorecard maintained for purposes of section 201 of S. Con. Res. 21 (110th Congress).

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) take effect on October 1, 2011.
Section 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 ( 7 U.S.C. 7333 ) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

In the case of an eligible crop described in paragraph (2), the Secretary of Agriculture shall operate a noninsured crop disaster assistance program to provide coverages based on individual yields (other than for value-loss crops) equivalent to—

clause.text:
additional coverage available under
subsections (c) and (h) of section 508 of that Act ( 7 U.S.C. 1508 ) that does not exceed 65 percent.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall carry out this section through the Farm Service Agency (referred to in this section as the Agency).
in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)—

subclause.text: in clause (i), by striking and after the semicolon at the end;
by redesignating clause (ii) as clause (iii); and
by inserting after clause (i) the following:

item.text:
for which additional coverage under
subsections (c) and (h) of section 508 of that Act ( 7 U.S.C. 1508 ) is not available; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text: by inserting (except ferns) after floricultural;
by inserting (except ferns) after ornamental nursery; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (d), by striking The Secretary and inserting Subject to subsection (l), the Secretary ;
in subsection (k)(1)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking $250 and inserting $260; and
in subparagraph (B)—

clause.text: by striking $750 and inserting $780; and
by striking $1,875 and inserting $1,950; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

The Secretary shall make available to a producer eligible for noninsured assistance under this section a payment equivalent to an indemnity for additional coverage under subsections (c) and (h) of section 508 of the Federal Crop Insurance Act ( 7 U.S.C. 1508 ) that does not exceed 65 percent, computed by multiplying—

subparagraph.text: 100 percent of the average market price for the crop, as determined by the Secretary; and
a payment rate for the type of crop, as determined by the Secretary, that reflects—

clause.text: in the case of a crop that is produced with a significant and variable harvesting expense, the decreasing cost incurred in the production cycle for the crop that is, as applicable—

subclause.text: harvested;
planted but not harvested; or

clause.text: in the case of a crop that is produced without a significant and variable harvesting expense, such rate as shall be determined by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: To be eligible to receive a payment under this subsection, a producer shall pay—

subparagraph.text: the service fee required by subsection (k); and
a premium for the applicable crop year that is equal to—

clause.text: the product obtained by multiplying—

subclause.text: the number of acres devoted to the eligible crop;
the yield, as determined by the Secretary under subsection (e);
the coverage level elected by the producer;
the average market price, as determined by the Secretary; and

clause.text: 5.25-percent premium fee.

paragraph.header: Limited resource, beginning, and socially disadvantaged farmers
paragraph.text: The additional coverage made available under this subsection shall be available to limited resource, beginning, and socially disadvantaged producers, as determined by the Secretary, in exchange for a premium that is 50 percent of the premium determined for a producer under paragraph (2).

subparagraph.text: As soon as practicable, the Secretary shall make assistance available to producers of an otherwise eligible crop described in subsection (a)(2) that suffered losses—

clause.text: to a 2012 annual fruit crop grown on a bush or tree; and
in a county covered by a declaration by the Secretary of a natural disaster for production losses due to a freeze or frost.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall make assistance available under subparagraph (A) in an amount equivalent to assistance available under paragraph (1), less any fees not previously paid under paragraph (2).

paragraph.text: Effective October 1, 2017, subsection (a) and the amendments made by subsection (a) (other than the amendments made by clauses (i)(I) and (ii) of subsection (a)(1)(B)) are repealed

Effective October 1, 2017, section 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 ( 7 U.S.C. 7333 ) shall be applied and administered as if subsection (a) and the amendments made by subsection (a) (other than the amendments made by clauses (i)(I) and (ii) of subsection (a)(1)(B)) had not been enacted.

section.header: Exemption of agriculture, nutrition, and forestry from BCA sequestration
section.text: Section 251A(6) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 ( 2 U.S.C. 901a(6) ), as redesignated by section 101 of this Act, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking On the date and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: On the date

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), as so designated, in the second sentence, by inserting subparagraph (B) of this paragraph and after the exemptions specified in; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Exemption of agriculture, nutrition, and forestry
subparagraph.text: The following shall be exempt from reduction under any order issued pursuant to this paragraph:

clause.text: All programs, projects, and activities of the Commodity Credit Corporation.
All programs, projects, and activities of the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation.
All programs, projects, and activities carried out under section 32 of the Act of August 24, 1935 ( 7 U.S.C. 612c ).
All other direct spending accounts of the Department of Agriculture.

section.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, this title and the amendments made by this title take effect on the date of enactment of, and as if included in, the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012 ( Public Law 112–240 ; 126 Stat. 2313).

Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this title an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.

section.header: Fair share tax on high-income taxpayers

subsection.text: Subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by adding at the end the following new part:

part.header: Fair share tax on high-income taxpayers

paragraph.text: In the case of any high-income taxpayer, there is hereby imposed for a taxable year (in addition to any other tax imposed by this subtitle) a tax equal to the product of—

subparagraph.text: the amount determined under paragraph (2), and
a fraction (not to exceed 1)—

clause.text: the numerator of which is the excess of—

subclause.text: the taxpayer's adjusted gross income, over
the dollar amount in effect under subsection (c)(1), and

clause.text: the denominator of which is $4,000,000 ($2,000,000 in the case of a married individual who files a separate return).

paragraph.text: The amount of tax determined under this paragraph is an amount equal to the excess (if any) of—

subparagraph.text: the tentative fair share tax for the taxable year, over
the excess of—

clause.text: the sum of—

subclause.text: the regular tax liability (as defined in section 26(b)) for the taxable year, determined without regard to any tax liability determined under this section,
the tax imposed by section 55 for the taxable year, plus
the payroll tax for the taxable year, over

clause.text: the credits allowable under part IV of subchapter A (other than sections 27(a), 31, and 34).

subsection.text: For purposes of this section—

paragraph.text: The tentative fair share tax for the taxable year is 30 percent of the excess of—

subparagraph.text: the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer, over
the modified charitable contribution deduction for the taxable year.

paragraph.text: For purposes of paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: The modified charitable contribution deduction for any taxable year is an amount equal to the amount which bears the same ratio to the deduction allowable under section 170 (section 642(c) in the case of a trust or estate) for such taxable year as—

clause.text: the amount of itemized deductions allowable under the regular tax (as defined in section 55) for such taxable year, determined after the application of section 68, bears to
such amount, determined before the application of section 68.

subparagraph.text: In the case of any individual who does not elect to itemize deductions for the taxable year, the modified charitable contribution deduction shall be zero.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section—

paragraph.text: The term high-income taxpayer means, with respect to any taxable year, any taxpayer (other than a corporation) with an adjusted gross income for such taxable year in excess of $1,000,000 (50 percent of such amount in the case of a married individual who files a separate return).

subparagraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after 2013, the $1,000,000 amount under paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: such dollar amount, multiplied by

the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2012 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subparagraph.text: If any amount as adjusted under subparagraph (A) is not a multiple of $10,000, such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $10,000.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the payroll tax for any taxable year is an amount equal to the excess of—

paragraph.text: the taxes imposed on the taxpayer under sections 1401, 1411, 3101, 3201, and 3211(a) (to the extent such tax is attributable to the rate of tax in effect under section 3101) with respect to such taxable year or wages or compensation received during such taxable year, over
the deduction allowable under section 164(f) for such taxable year.

subsection.header: Special rule for estates and trusts
subsection.text: For purposes of this section, in the case of an estate or trust, adjusted gross income shall be computed in the manner described in section 67(e).

subsection.header: Not treated as tax imposed by this chapter for certain purposes
subsection.text: The tax imposed under this section shall not be treated as tax imposed by this chapter for purposes of determining the amount of any credit under this chapter (other than the credit allowed under section 27(a)) or for purposes of section 55.
The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Part VIII—Fair share tax on high-Income taxpayers

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

section.header: Denial of deduction for outsourcing expenses

subsection.text: Part IX of subchapter B of chapter 1 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
No deduction otherwise allowable under this chapter shall be allowed for any specified outsourcing expense.
For purposes of this section—

paragraph.text: The term specified outsourcing expense means—

subparagraph.text: any eligible expense paid or incurred by the taxpayer in connection with the elimination of any business unit of the taxpayer (or of any member of any expanded affiliated group in which the taxpayer is also a member) located within the United States, and

any eligible expense paid or incurred by the taxpayer in connection with the establishment of any business unit of the taxpayer (or of any member of any expanded affiliated group in which the taxpayer is also a member) located outside the United States,

paragraph.continuation-text: if such establishment constitutes the relocation of the business unit so eliminated. For purposes of the preceding sentence, a relocation shall not be treated as failing to occur merely because such elimination occurs in a different taxable year than such establishment.

paragraph.text: The term eligible expenses means—

subparagraph.text: any amount for which a deduction is allowed to the taxpayer under section 162, and
permit and license fees, lease brokerage fees, equipment installation costs, and, to the extent provided by the Secretary, other similar expenses.

paragraph.continuation-text: Such term does not include any compensation which is paid or incurred in connection with severance from employment and, to the extent provided by the Secretary, any similar amount.

paragraph.text: The term business unit means—

subparagraph.text: any trade or business, and
any line of business, or functional unit, which is part of any trade or business.

paragraph.text: The term expanded affiliated group means an affiliated group as defined in section 1504(a), determined without regard to section 1504(b)(3) and by substituting more than 50 percent for at least 80 percent each place it appears in section 1504(a). A partnership or any other entity (other than a corporation) shall be treated as a member of an expanded affiliated group if such entity is controlled (within the meaning of section 954(d)(3)) by members of such group (including any entity treated as a member of such group by reason of this paragraph).

paragraph.header: Operating expenses not taken into account
paragraph.text: Any amount paid or incurred in connection with the on-going operation of a business unit shall not be treated as an amount paid or incurred in connection with the establishment or elimination of such business unit.

paragraph.header: Application to deductions for depreciation and amortization
paragraph.text: In the case of any portion of a specified outsourcing expense which is not deductible in the taxable year in which paid or incurred, such portion shall neither be chargeable to capital account nor amortizable.

paragraph.header: Possessions treated as part of the United States
paragraph.text: For purposes of this section, the term United States shall be treated as including each possession of the United States (including the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands).

subsection.text: The Secretary shall prescribe such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the purposes of this section, including regulations which provide (or create a rebuttable presumption) that certain establishments of business units outside the United States will be treated as relocations (based on timing or such other factors as the Secretary may provide) of business units eliminated within the United States.

subsection.header: Limitation on subpart F income of controlled foreign corporations determined without regard to specified outsourcing expenses
subsection.text: Subsection (c) of section 952 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Earnings and profits determined without regard to specified outsourcing expenses
paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, earnings and profits of any controlled foreign corporation shall be determined without regard to any specified outsourcing expense (as defined in section 280I(b)).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts paid or incurred after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Modifications to the tax on petroleum

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 4612(a) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term crude oil includes crude oil condensates, natural gasoline, any bitumen or bituminous mixture, and any oil derived from a bitumen or bituminous mixture.

subsection.header: Removing restrictions relating to oil wells and extraction methods
subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 4612(a) is amended by striking from a well located.
Subclause (I) of section 4612(e)(2)(B)(ii) is amended by striking tranferred and inserting transferred.

The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) shall apply to oil and petroleum products received or entered during calendar quarters beginning more than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

endorsement.action-desc: Read twice and placed on the calendar pursuant to the order of February 14, 2013
